definition: obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity

sentences.english: Have you ever seen a one -legged dog making its way down the street?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾见过一只在街上默默行走的的独脚小狗？

sentences.english: After the waitress arrived with our food, we ate in silence for a time.
sentences.chinese: 女招待端来了我们的晚餐，我们默默地吃了一会儿。

sentences.english: They gazed in awe at their hero.
sentences.chinese: 那个孩子默默无言，以畏怯的目光凝视着他。

sentences.english: But more mouthed along listlessly or stared in silence.
sentences.chinese: 但更多的人只是无精打采地张着嘴或默默地发呆。

sentences.english: Mute recall him , maybe grow this world here being able to not have forgot.
sentences.chinese: 默默的记起他，也许此生此世都不会忘记了。

sentences.english: Feelings are like waters, the shallow murmurs, but the deep are dumb.
sentences.chinese: 感情如流水，浅处淙淙有声，深处默默无语。

sentences.english: Mother and son left. They walked along the street in silence.
sentences.chinese: 母子俩离开药店，默默地走在街上。

sentences.english: I mourned quietly inside my room.
sentences.chinese: 我在我的房间中默默哀悼。

sentences.english: While Jove 's planet rises yonder, silent over Africa.
sentences.chinese: 当朱匹特的行星高高升起，默默凝照着非洲的大地。

sentences.english: Often as they all sat together every one was silent.
sentences.chinese: 他们都坐在一起，常常默默无语。

sentences.english: There must havebeen 30,000 chickens sitting silently on the floor in front of me.
sentences.chinese: 那里一定有3万只鸡默默地在我前面的地上。

sentences.english: Sometimes, it is better to remain unknown than to make pimple hate you.
sentences.chinese: 有时，保持默默无闻比让人恨你要好得多。

sentences.english: The mouse Woods also quietly climbed Tuotuo hereby around, looked up the moon with him.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠呜兹也默默地爬到脱脱身边，陪着他抬头看月亮。

sentences.english: Silently she walked to the birches without even a sigh.
sentences.chinese: 她默默来到那片白桦林。

sentences.english: I drove behind him, begging him all the way, but he walked silently.
sentences.chinese: 我开车跟在后面，一路都在求他，但他默默地走着。

sentences.english: As for him, he only endure it in silence.
sentences.chinese: 至于男孩，他只是默默地承受着。

definition: to remain silent/to have nothing to say
rear view/figure seen from behind/view of the back (of a person or object)
to bow the head/to yield/to give in
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
to immerse oneself in/engrossed in sth/to lower the head (e.g. to avoid rain)/countersunk (of screws, rivets etc)
one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
